t: Psalm 44
Redemption Remembered in Present Dishonor
To the Chief Musician. A Contemplation of the sons of Korah.
We*pn have heard with our ears, O God, Our*ld fathers have told us, The*ld deeds You did in their days, In*ld days of old:
You*ld drove out the nations with Your hand, But*ld them You planted; You*ld afflicted the peoples, and cast them out.

For*ld they did not gain possession of the land by their own sword, Nor*ld did their own arm save them; But*ld it was Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your countenance, Because*ld You favored them.
You*ln are my King, O God; Command*ld victories for Jacob.
Through*ld You we will push down our enemies; Through*ld Your name we will trample those who rise up against us.
For*ld I will not trust in my bow, Nor*ld shall my sword save me.
But*ld You have saved us from our enemies, And*ld have put to shame those who hated us.
In*ld God we boast all day long, And*ld praise Your name forever. Selah*ipg
But*pn You have cast us*i off and put us to shame, And*ld You do not go out with our armies.
You*ld make us turn back from the enemy, And*ld those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
You*ld have given us up like sheep intended*i for food, And*ld have scattered us among the nations.
You*ld sell Your people for next*i to*i nothing, And*ld are not enriched by selling them.
You*ln make us a reproach to our neighbors, A*ld scorn and a derision to those all around us.
You*ld make us a byword among the nations, A*ld shaking of the head among the peoples.
My*ld dishonor is*i continually before me, And*ld the shame of my face has covered me,
Because*ld of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, Because*ld of the enemy and the avenger.
All*ln this has come upon us; But*ld we have not forgotten You, Nor*ld have we dealt falsely with Your covenant.
Our*ld heart has not turned back, Nor*ld have our steps departed from Your way;
But*ld You have severely broken us in the place of jackals, And*ld covered us with the shadow of death.
If*ln we had forgotten the name of our God, Or*ld stretched out our hands to a foreign god,
Would*ld not God search this out? For*ld He knows the secrets of the heart.
Yet*ld for Your sake we are killed all day long; We*ld are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
Awake!*ln Why do You sleep, O Lord? Arise!*ld Do not cast us*i off forever.
Why*ld do You hide Your face, And*ild forget our affliction and our oppression?
For*ld our soul is bowed down to the dust; Our*ld body clings to the ground.
Arise*ld for our help, And*ld redeem us for Your merciesâ€™ sake.
